definition: same trade or business/person in the same trade or business
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The profession and the public do not appreciate that advertising claims come without proof in the case of diets.

sentences.english: I. You are approved to launch the inter-bank entrusted loans business with financial institutions.

sentences.chinese: 在國民黨統治時期，同業公會是商會的基層組織。

sentences.english: Interbank lending rates have come down and stabilized, but banks are not yet lending.

sentences.english: We heard from the trade that your company is considering diversifying into telecommunication business.

sentences.english: In the industry survey, we came in third overall among our peer group.

sentences.english: Many euro-zone corporate and household loans use those interbank rates as a benchmark.

sentences.english: Corporations and trade associations are recruiting Democratic lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 企業和同業工會正僱用民主黨說客。

sentences.english: And that's where the competition thinks it has an advantage.
sentences.chinese: 這也是同業競爭者認爲它的優勢所在。

sentences.english: Many other insurers follow an in-and-out approach.
sentences.chinese: 配合許多保險同業遵循的進出策略。
